text: Player teeing off at the 2007 Auckland Urban Open, New Zealand Urban golf is a game, based on the original game of golf, in which individual players or teams hit a ball into a hole or at a specified target using various clubs. Urban golf is played without a traditional golf course, instead using street furniture as obstacles and targets. Instead of a standard golf ball, players may use a leather ball.http://news.bbc.co.uk/sportacademy/hi/sa/golf/features/newsid_3630000/3630213.stm BBC ==See also== * Golf glossary * Golf instruction * Nineteenth hole * Word golf * Wiffle golf ==References== * Katu's Keep Portland Weird Top 3 Events * Good Magazine Video * Flux Magazine ==External links== * New York Times article Category:Forms of golf
title: Urban golf
